title: Binance claims code leak on GitHub is ‘outdated,’ poses minor risk
description:
Binance claimed the information was a “negligible risk” to users, but an earlier GitHub takedown request said it was a “significant risk” to the exchange.

Crypto exchange Binance has refuted a report claiming a “highly sensitive” cache of internal passwords and code had been exposed on GitHub for months — arguing the code was outdated and posed a “negligible risk.”

According to a Jan. 31 report from 404 Media, there was a cache of “code, infrastructure diagrams, internal passwords, and other technical information,” including information about how the exchange carries out passwords and multi-factor authentication.

The report notes that Binance successfully petitioned GitHub to scrub the files through a Jan. 24 copyright takedown request, where the exchange said the information “poses [a] significant risk” and was posted “without authorization.”

Read more

title: Traders pumped and dumped another ‘JUP’ during $700M Jupiter airdrop
description:
Some traders may have speculated on the price of the wrong token, while a 17-year-old trader claims to have raked in $1 million in airdrops of the real Jupiter token.

A seven-year-old defunct Ethereum-based protocol may have briefly benefitted from the $700 million airdrop for Solana-based exchange aggregator Jupiter, due to a similar price ticker.

On Jan. 31, hours before the launch of Solana-based Jupiter’s airdrop of “JUP,” an Ethereum-based token with the same ticker spiked more than 430% on Jan. 31, before plummeting just hours later.

According to data from CoinMarketCap, the price of Ethereum-based JUP went from $0.005 on Jan. 30 to $0.026 on Jan. 31 before plummeting back to its current price of $0.007.

Read more

title: Huawei’s AirEngine Wi-Fi 7: Revolutionizing Intelligent Collaboration in Education
description: Huawei, a global technology leader, has unveiled its cutting-edge enterprise-class “AirEngine Wi-Fi 7” solution, ushering in a new era of intelligent collaboration. In the education sector, this latest generation of Wi-Fi standards promises to offer a more seamless and reliable wireless network, particularly in high-density, high-bandwidth, and low-latency scenarios.  The 21st-century classroom is no longer […]
